article.headline: Bowling Green 66, Central Michigan 44
article.story: BOWLING GREEN, Ohio (AP) -- Martin Somarco scored 12 points and Bowling Green ran off 16 consecutive points in the middle of the game to beat Central Michigan 66-44 on Wednesday night. Mawel Soler added 11 points for the Falcons (5-6, 1-0 Mid-American Conference) who won despite being outrebounded 42-31 and outscored at the line 21-9. Sefton Barrett had 17 points for Central Michigan (2-8, 0-2), which never led after Drew Walker opened the scoring. Bowling Green ran off the next eight points -- the first four by Soler -- and went on to lead 30-18 at the half and by as many as 25 points in the second half. In addition to turning the ball over 28 times, the Chippewas hit just 26.2 percent of their shots from the field (11 of 42) and made just one of 11 3-pointers. With the Falcons holding a 22-18 lead late in the first half, they scored the final eight points of the half and the first eight points of the second half. Soler and John Floyd each scored five points in the 16-0 run.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
